field.label: Use the product name as the meta title for the product detail
field.comment: If your product data already has Meta Title leave it as (No)

field.label: Wait for index completion
field.comment: If enabled, the import will wait for any running indexers to complete before starting the import process. With this setting off, the import will fail/cancel if any indexers are running when it starts. (Waits a maximum of 30 minutes for indexers to complete)

field.label: Multi-source Stock
field.comment: If enabled, the import will process stock with one source per distributor, otherwise all stock will be provided by the default source. Enabling this has no effect unless the MSI modules are active

field.label: Permit Zero Price
field.comment: Enable if you wish to allow products with a price of 0. When disabled, zero prices are treated as feed errors and silently dropped. Only affects prices processed by the import module as part of Group Pricing

field.label: Import Success notification email destination
field.comment: If blank or not a valid email, does not send success emails

field.label: Custom Catalog triggers Indexers during Stock & Price imports
field.comment: Enable this if you need the effects of CC rule changes to become available immediately after Stock & Price imports. Otherwise, their values will be updated, but the relevant indexers not invalidated or triggered, resulting in a significantly faster Stock & Price import, at the cost of some minor inconsistencies in CC visibility state for products whose rule changed during the import. This option has no effect on Full imports, they always fully reindex

group.label: FTP Login Details
group.comment: Get these details from Stock in the Channel for the pricelist you want this store to use. This is not your Stock in the Channel username and password.

field.label: Use FTPES
field.comment: Enables FTPES, triggering a TLS exchange for encrypted data transfer where possible

field.label: Backup Data
field.comment: Backup current Ids of products and categories to re-use when importing in overwrite mode.

group.label: Import Full Catalogue
group.comment: An import of 100000 products will take approximately 1 hour.Larger catalogues will take substantially longer. (It may take up to a minute before the import starts)

field.label: Run the Indexing Separately
field.comment: Run the re-indexing as a separate task.

group.label: Import Stock & Prices
group.comment: This will import stock and prices ONLY. This process should not take longer 5 minutes. (It may take up to a minute before the import starts)

field.label: Product URL Template
field.comment:
Provides the template that URL rewrite generation uses for products. The following markers are replaced during generation:
{name} - Replaced with product Name
{sku} - Replaced with product SKU
{id} - Replaced with product ID
{ean} - Replaced with product EAN
{unspsc} - Replaced with product UNSPSC
{brand} - Replaced with the product Manufacturer name

field.label: Visible in Admin
field.comment: Enable this if you want to check/edit attribute values within the Admin panel. It is applied on import

field.label: Override Elasticsuite
field.comment: When enabled, overrides Elasticsuite's "Facet Min Coverage" functionality for Stockinthechannel Filterable Attributes, reverting them to default behaviour

field.label: Enable Summary Features Display
field.comment: When enabled, injects Stockinthechannel Summary Features into Magento product list pages. Please note this does not affect blocks in grid mode

field.label: Enable Bullet Points Display
field.comment: When enabled, injects Stockinthechannel Bullet Points into Magento product list pages. Please note this does not affect blocks in grid mode

group.label: Cron Schedule
group.comment:
Enter cron expression

* * * * *
| | | | |
| | | | +---- Day of the Week (range: 0-6, 1 standing for Monday)
| | | +------ Month of the Year (range: 1-12)
| | +-------- Day of the Month (range: 1-31)
| +---------- Hour (range: 0-23)
+------------ Minute (range: 0-59)
Example: */5 * * * * - every five minutes

Read more about cron expressions - here

field.label: Enable
field.comment: May require disabling the "Blocks HTML output" cache (block_html) for the menu to update correctly on some themes

field.label: Disable import section
field.comment: If you have no intention of using the Category visibility functionality in the near future, enable this option to skip this section of the import

field.label: Enable
field.comment: Requires disabling the "Page Cache" cache (full_page). Recommended to be using Smile ElasticSuite for full functionality

field.label: Disable import section
field.comment: If you have no intention of using the Product visibility functionality in the near future, enable this option to skip this section of the import

field.label: Clear reservations on imported products
field.comment: If enabled, clear inventory reservations for affected products when importing new stock levels, and calculate stock status based on stock + backorder limit. When disabled, the saleable quantity (stock + backorder limit - reservations) is used to determine stock status

group.label: In Stock Filter
group.comment: To change the label used by the attribute itself (i.e. 'Availability'), navigate to 'Stores > Attributes > Product'

field.label: Manual Source Assignment
field.comment: When enabled, the import will not assign sources (distributors) to the Sinch stock

field.label: Verify name match when fixing quote items
field.comment:
When disabled, SKU is assumed to be GLOBALLY UNIQUE (i.e. a product with a given SKU always represents the same product, even if the names differ)
When enabled (the default), checks that the item name and the replacement candidate name identically match before updating quote item records (the replacement candidate is still matched based on SKU)

field.label: ANY_VALUE Implementation
field.comment:
The implementation of ANY_VALUE to use when selecting records not specified in the GROUP BY condition (primarily Product Supplier).
The default is acceptable on all databases except MariaDB, which fails to implement ANY_VALUE

field.label: Category search weight
field.comment: The search weight for the category name field

field.label: Brand name search weight
field.comment: The search weight for the brand name field

field.label: Enable Enhanced Search
field.comment: When enabled, attempt to refine searches to improve their relevance and specificity

field.label: Enable automatic price filtering
field.comment: When enabled, strip terms like "between 100 and 200", "below 500", "above 666" from searches and turn them into price filters

field.label: Enable automatic category filtering
field.comment: When enabled, strip terms like "in Computers", "in Notebooks", etc from searches and turn them into category filters

field.label: Enable automatic attribute filtering
field.comment: When enabled, strip terms matching manufacturer, sinch_family, or sinch_family_series attribute values from searches and turn them into attribute filters

field.label: Enable automatic dynamic category filtering
field.comment: Provides the same functionality as the above category filtering option, but doesn't require "in" to be present in the search terms. This runs separately after the above filters, and thus can be controlled independently

field.label: Enable automatic redirects from search results to more appropriate category pages
field.comment: Whether to enable redirects during enhanced search processing. Without this enabled, filters are simply added to the constructed query to further limit it

field.label: Redirects only strip regex terms
field.comment: With this enabled, only redirect to strip the regex based enhanced terms (price and category). Otherwise, redirects are used wherever possible

field.label: Redirects avoid categories
field.comment: With this enabled, redirects avoid automatically selecting categories due to empty query text (or remaining text being a category name), instead rolling it back to the original minus regex terms

field.label: Enable empty query restore mode
field.comment: When enabled, unwinds query text modification if the result is empty. Otherwise, replaces the entire must clause of the generated query to ensure it remains valid, but might cause minor incompatibilities. Probably worth leaving this on

field.label: Minimum matching products to consider filter valid
field.comment: The minimum number of products required to match a filter in order for it to be considered valid. A value of 0 disables the validation, slightly reducing the number of queries to ES, however it will worsen search results noticeably in some cases.

field.label: Enable Additional Autocomplete Suggestions
field.comment: Whether to produce additional autocomplete suggestions based on automatic category filtering (non-dynamic)

field.label: Enable Debug Logging to File
field.comment: Whether SearchProcessing and QueryBuilder also log to file in addition to the browser loggers

group.label: Popularity Boost
group.comment: Boost the position of products in collections based on additional Stockinthechannel provided attributes

field.label: Show Advanced Settings
field.comment: Only enable if you know what you're doing and are happy with fixing things yourself

field.label: Really Show Advanced Settings
field.comment: By enabling this you agree that you won't whine to Stockinthechannel if you break things. That's twice you've been warned now. On your head be it

field.label: Show Really Advanced Settings
field.comment: Looks like the above setting, but this one controls whether you can change even deeper logic. You should probably avoid this unless you're Nick or Joe

field.label: Score Boost Factor
field.comment: Factor used for the "sinch_score" attribute

field.label: Score Boost Modifier
field.comment: Modifier used for the "sinch_score" attribute. Must be one of: none, log, log1p, log2p, ln, ln1p, ln2p, square, sqrt, reciprocal

field.label: Score Boost Weight
field.comment: Weight used for the "sinch_score" attribute relative to the other boosts

field.label: Monthly Popularity Boost Factor
field.comment: Factor to use for the "sinch_popularity_month" attribute (Monthly Stockinthechannel Implied Sales)

field.label: Monthly Popularity Boost Modifier
field.comment: Modifier used for the "sinch_popularity_month" attribute. Must be one of: none, log, log1p, log2p, ln, ln1p, ln2p, square, sqrt, reciprocal

field.label: Monthly Popularity Boost Weight
field.comment: Weight used for the "sinch_popularity_month" attribute relative to the other boosts

field.label: Yearly Popularity Boost Factor
field.comment: Factor to use for the "sinch_popularity_year" attribute (Yearly Stockinthechannel Implied Sales)

field.label: Yearly Popularity Boost Modifier
field.comment: Modifier used for the "sinch_popularity_year" attribute. Must be one of: none, log, log1p, log2p, ln, ln1p, ln2p, square, sqrt, reciprocal

field.label: Yearly Popularity Boost Weight
field.comment: Weight used for the "sinch_popularity_year" attribute relative to the other boosts

field.label: Search Data Boost Factor
field.comment: Factor to use for the "sinch_searches" attribute (Stockinthechannel search data)

field.label: Search Data Boost Modifier
field.comment: Modifier used for the "sinch_searches" attribute. Must be one of: none, log, log1p, log2p, ln, ln1p, ln2p, square, sqrt, reciprocal

field.label: Search Data Boost Weight
field.comment: Weight used for the "sinch_searches" attribute relative to the other boosts

group.label: Product Badges
group.comment: Badges for notable products on the first page of collections. Works best in combination with Popularity Boost, but not required

field.label: Bestseller Badge Content
field.comment: Content used for bestseller product badge, typically SVG

field.label: Hot Product Badge Content
field.comment: Content used for hot product badge, typically SVG

field.label: New Product Badge Content
field.comment: Content used for new product badge, typically SVG

field.label: Popular Product Badge Content
field.comment: Content used for popular product badge, typically SVG

field.label: Recommended Product Badge Content
field.comment: Content used for recommended product badge, typically SVG

field.label: Feed Provided Relation Type
field.comment: The type of relation to use for feed specified related products

field.label: Generate Upsell Products
field.comment: Whether the import module should generate its own Upsell products. Ignored if Feed Provided Relation Type is Upsell

field.label: Generate Related Products
field.comment: Whether the import module should generate its own Related products. Ignored if Feed Provided Relation Type is Related

field.label: Popularity Boost
field.comment: Whether relation positions should be adjusted to make more popular products appear higher

field.label: Monthly Sales Boost
field.comment: Whether relation positions should be adjusted to make products with higher monthly implied sales appear higher

field.label: Yearly Sales Boost
field.comment: Whether relation positions should be adjusted to make products with higher yearly implied sales appear higher

field.label: Profit Boost
field.comment: Whether relation positions should be adjusted to make products with a higher profit ratio appear higher

field.label: Product Family Boost
field.comment: Whether relation positions should be adjusted to make products sharing its Family/Series appear higher

field.label: Include Upsell Comparison Block
field.comment: Whether Product view pages include our version of the Upsell block, which compares similar attributes

field.label: Upsell Comparison Block Number of Products
field.comment: The limit on the number of products to display in the Upsell Comparison Block
